messages.message: I tried changing my `cluster_id` to `dogfood` in job-service/deployment-config.json but that hasn’t worked
is there more context to this question? or did you post in the wrong channel? :slightly_smiling_face:
ok, so apparently the databases have been moved to separate clusters which means that our local dev env cannot access any of these jobs results.
which makes us have to run those flows locally to produce new data. The issue is that this takes a lot of time to do (1. cause local is slower, 2. cause it doesn’t always work right)
so I’m trying to figure out if theres a way for me to point my local env at dogfood so I can run flows on dogfood and then debug and work with the results locally.
in which @Anil had suggested that I change the `cluster_id` to dogfood, but that hasn’t worked (or maybe I did it wrong?)
this might be a case that I’m using `--as-docker` so I’ll try without that
you just want to point your local environment to the dogfood database?
we haven’t changed the dogfood database, it’s still the same as prod and local env
ok rebuilding job-service worked and I’m getting the dogfood data now
